      • editUser

        @RequestMapping(value="/updateUser",
                method=POST)
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<java.lang.Object> editUser​(@RequestBody
                                                                          User user,
                                                                          @CurrentUser
                                                                          MyUserPrincipal principal)
        This method edits the current user's information with the information contained inside another user object which is passed through the parameters as a JSON. THen the updated user is saved in the database and user repository.
        Parameters:
        user - A user object passed in as a JSON corresponding user object in the user repository.
        principal - A user object with username and password that holds the current logged in user.
        Returns:
        Http Status Code ResponseEntity

      • createOrEditAddress

        @RequestMapping(value="/address",
                method=POST)
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<java.lang.Object> createOrEditAddress​(@RequestBody
                                                                                     Address address,
                                                                                     @CurrentUser
                                                                                     MyUserPrincipal principal)
        This method edits the current user's address with the information contained inside the address object that is passed in through the parameters as a JSON. Then the address is saved in the database and address repository.
        Parameters:
        address - An address object passed in as a JSON corresponding address object in the address repository.
        principal - A user object with username and password that holds the current logged in user.
        Returns:
        Http Status Code ResponseEntity

      • updateAddress

        static void updateAddress​(@RequestBody
                          Address address,
                          Address updateAddress)
        This method checks if the address object provided through the parameters is null. If its null, then it does not update that data field in the already existing address.
        Parameters:
        address - An address object passed in as a JSON corresponding restaurant object in the restaurant repository.
        updateAddress - An address object passed in as a JSON that contains the new information that the already existing address will be updated to.

      • testing

        @RequestMapping(value="/test",
                method=GET)
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<java.lang.Object> testing​(@CurrentUser
                                                                         MyUserPrincipal principal)
        This method gets a user object that is found by using the currently logged in user's username.
        Parameters:
        principal - A user object with username and password that holds the current logged in user.
        Returns:
        Http Status Code ResponseEntity

      • createProduct

        @RequestMapping(value="/users",
                method=POST)
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<java.lang.Object> createProduct​(@RequestBody
                                                                               User user)
        This method registers a user with the information sent in the parameters. Then this user object is saved in the database and user repository.
        Parameters:
        user - A user object that is sent as a JSON who's ID corresponds to an existing user object in the user repository.
        Returns:
        Http Status Code ResponseEntity

        Throws:

      • checkLogin

        @RequestMapping(value="/login",
                method=POST)
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<java.lang.Object> checkLogin​(@RequestBody
                                                                            User user)
        This method logs in and authenticates a user if the information sent in the parameters corresponds to an existing user's username and password in the user repository.
        Parameters:
        user - A user object that is sent as a JSON
        Returns:
        Http Status Code ResponseEntity

                method=GET)
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<java.lang.Object> getUsers()
        This method gets all users that have the role "OWNER"
        Returns:
        Http Status Code ResponseEntity

      • getUser

        @RequestMapping(value="/currentUser",
                method=GET)
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<java.lang.Object> getUser​(@CurrentUser
                                                                         MyUserPrincipal principal)
        This method gets the currently logged in user as a user object. If it is not found then it returns a dummy user with null values.
        Parameters:
        principal - A user object with username and password that holds the current logged in user.
        Returns:
        Http Status Code ResponseEntity

      • payUser

        @RequestMapping(value="/payUser",
                method=PUT)
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<java.lang.Object> payUser​(@CurrentUser
                                                                         MyUserPrincipal principal,
                                                                         @RequestBody
                                                                         User user)
        This method gets the currently logged in user and adds to that that user's 'earnings' value with the value provided in a new user object through the parameters. Then it saves this user to the database and user repository.
        Parameters:
        principal - A user object with username and password that holds the current logged in user.
        user - A user object that contains a unique username corresponding to an existing user in the user repository.
        Returns:
        Http Status Code ResponseEntity
